abstract.p: Season-ending championship on men's senior tennis circuit will begin at Wollman Rink in Central Park; outlook noted (S)

block.p: The season-ending championship on the men's senior tennis circuit will begin tonight at the Wollman Rink in Central Park with Jimmy Connors facing Mats Wilander.

Eight players are divided into two groups for round-robin matches in the LastMinuteTravel.com Masters, with afternoon and evening sessions. The top two survivors in each group will meet in Saturday's semifinals, with the final on Sunday.
The season-ending championship on the men's senior tennis circuit will begin tonight at the Wollman Rink in Central Park with Jimmy Connors facing Mats Wilander.

Eight players are divided into two groups for round-robin matches in the LastMinuteTravel.com Masters, with afternoon and evening sessions. The top two survivors in each group will meet in Saturday's semifinals, with the final on Sunday.
In one group are John McEnroe, Henri Leconte, Mikael Pernfors and Mansour Bahrami. In the second group are Wilander, Connors, Andres Gomez and Bjorn Borg.

The Connors-Borg round-robin match will be played Friday afternoon and may be of special interest to fans who recall their matches at Forest Hills and the National Tennis Center. McEnroe will play Pernfors on Thursday at 7 p.m. and Leconte Friday at 7 p.m.
Total prize money in the event will be $250,000.
